abstract.text: The editable content for a notification.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: object when you want to specify the payload for a local notification. Specifically, use this object to specify the title and message for an alert, the sound to play, or the value to assign to your app’s badge. You might also provide details about how the system handles the notification. For example, you can specify a custom launch image and a thread identifier for visually grouping related notifications.
After creating your content object, assign it to a

object, add a trigger condition, and schedule your notification. The trigger condition defines when the system delivers the notification to the user. Listing 1 shows the scheduling of a local notification that displays an alert and plays a sound after a delay of five seconds. Store the strings for the alert’s title and body in the app’s
Listing 1. Creating the content for a local notification

code: // Deliver the notification in five seconds.
let request = UNNotificationRequest(identifier: "FiveSecond", content: content, trigger: trigger) // Schedule the notification.
// Deliver the notification in five seconds.

inlineContent.text: Local notifications always result in user interactions, and the system ignores any interactions for which your app isn’t authorized. For information about how to request authorization for user interactions, see
Localize the strings you display in a notification alert for the current user. Although you can use the
macros to load strings from your app’s resource files, a better option is to specify your string using the

method delays the loading of the localized string until the system delivers the notification. If the user changes the language setting before the system delivers a notification, the system updates the alert text to the user’s current language instead of the language in use when the system scheduled the notification.

UserNotifications-PageImage-card.png.alt: [A notification interface displayed on the lock screen of an iOS device.]

abstract.text: Returns a localized version of a string from the default table, which Xcode autogenerates when exporting localizations.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
Returns a localized string intended for display in a notification alert.
Push user-facing notifications to the user’s device from a server, or generate them locally from your app.
The editable content for a notification.
The visual and audio attachments to display alongside the notification’s main content.
The number that your app’s icon displays.
The localized text that provides the notification’s main content.
The identifier of the notification’s category.
The criteria the system evaluates to determine if it displays the notification in the current Focus.
The notification’s importance and required delivery timing.
The name of the image or storyboard to use when your app launches because of the notification.
The score the system uses to determine if the notification is the summary’s featured notification.
The sound that plays when the system delivers the notification.
The localized text that provides the notification’s secondary description.
The text the system adds to the notification summary to provide additional context.
The number the system adds to the notification summary when the notification represents multiple items.
The value your app uses to determine which scene to display to handle the notification.
The identifier that groups related notifications.
The localized text that provides the notification’s primary description.
The custom data to associate with the notification.
An icon associated with an action.
A media file associated with a notification.
The uneditable content of a notification.
A protocol the system uses to provide context relevant to user notifications.
Constants that indicate the importance and delivery timing of a notification.
A request to schedule a local notification, which includes the content of the notification and the trigger conditions for delivery.
The sound played upon delivery of a notification.
A string providing the name of a sound file.
Request permission to display alerts, play sounds, or badge the app’s icon in response to a notification.
Differentiate your notifications and add action buttons to the notification interface.
Configure and display your app’s communication notifications by using intents.
Modify the payload of a remote notification before it’s displayed on the user’s iOS device.

doc://com.apple.usernotifications/docume.title: Modifying content in newly delivered notifications

abstract.text: A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
A protocol that mutable objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.

value.text: A static, plain-text Unicode string object.
